This is not a simple question to answer as these vaccine were introduced at different times for different age groups. Section 1A of the BCCDC Immunization Manual has a section titled €œHistory of Immunization in BC€ that contains the information you are looking for.  This is a health care provider resource.  If would like help interpreting the information, we recommend that you contact your local public health unit and ask to speak with a public health nurse.
If you are wondering which vaccines you may have received in the past, you can find tips for locating immunization records here. Without a record of immunization, a person is generally considered unimmunized. 
- Immunization Nurse
